content.location: Just upstream of the Juliet's Balcony

content.description: Start at the upstream facing wall below the ledge at the base of Epigone.  There is a dark wet chimney just upstream. Climb the crack on the right side of the face.
content.location: Juliet's Balcony area of Great Falls Park VA.

content.description: Just upsream from Juliets Balcony there are several dihedrals that offer good climbing, inluding Mantlepiece.  Sciolist starts to the right (upstream) of Mantelpiece. Start to the left of the jam crack - climb the wall following the incipient crack.
content.location: Just upstream of Juliets Balcony there are several dihedrals.

content.description: Start 15 feet left of Mantlepiece at an upstream facing corner.  Climb the corner to the edge of the main ledge, step right and then continue up the inside corner.
content.location: Juliet's Balcony area of Great Falls Park Va

content.description: A fun route and the longest one at Juliet's Balcony. Thought provoking crux (no spoilers here). It was a little dirty when I climbed it so give it a look over when rapping down.
content.protection: Easy anchors at the top. Numerous trees to choose from. No need for trad gear. A retired 30m rope will give you plenty of choices for a bomber anchor
content.location: From the top of the cliff head about 15' to the climbers right of the rightmost corner of the prominent ledge that is Juliet's Balcony, there you will find the beginning (or the end depending on how you look at it) of Mantlepiece

content.description: Follow the obvious hand crack to the top. If this where either longer, or steeper, or both, it would be an area classic. As it is, it's still a good place to practice jamming.
content.location: On the upstream side of the cliff is this obvious splitter.

content.description: Just upstream from Juliet's Balcony there are several dihedrals that offer some decent climbing.
